description: Nikola Petrak advises a trusted Council member to promote cooperation among factions by emphasizing the shared goal of restoring stability.
An emergency task force is formally established, including representatives from all factions, to oversee coordination of BCI stabilization efforts.
The emergency task force begins implementing strategies to mitigate BCI scoring anomalies and improve system reliability.
Improved BCI stability results in reduced access issues for citizens, leading to cautious optimism within the Council.
Council releases a statement highlighting the stabilization progress achieved by the emergency task force and urges continued public patience.
Service access gradually improves as BCI subsystems recalibrate, providing relief to citizens and bolstering public confidence in government efforts.
Council gains cautious support from international partners interested in observing Stenograd's crisis management, though long-term challenges remain.
